document.title: Hawai ªi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

5F7330AFA88540B1AFE0B9298BB68823.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domain specific words and phrases, including those that signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that night we went looking for them).

15149900DFBC4F18AEDA1C61BD48CDA0.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

8B1656EFBA6845ADBE37422A25CC8119.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).

483A900FDE9F4F3A9E480EBFE39C2781.description: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

BA3A270777FA42F5BEF2691B10B44F78.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings:

CA0F64ADFF5F4D5F8B356CEC686F7B26.description: Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

5CA182EA97E74FF2AA472C132B31AF89.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

85ABBCEAC8044F78BA04E2B2CBC9683B.description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

181FCEC62A364D289CCABA33C767EC5D.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

C8B94A4CFAAA4F709498282DFD033317.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies:

000E7FCCD9FD43039BC4FA4F7D15F3D7.description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

862A8E133F034B2095C7B4CD5F607541.description: Use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

149D7FFC739F476A8AB971638280F350.description: Use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.

C1027AE5280A426FAA5EE6CC5DB04B64.description: Use regular and irregular plural nouns.

470F031984284CEAA2CCBF3DF16B4960.description: Use and explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

DF684AED4947448FBBC7FC9129A4C38A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

465E680872104B1D803FD2BF7DF16BA4.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

AB16F7F2A0F347AD9F5289FD949E26BC.description: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

73AA47D9A76A423595CC0A55F4A757C8.description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

18B1853191B04AD1887258392FFB715E.description: Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

CE85B14B10694A3789A76F50DE4B5971.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

956246F114864147AEF957E2264F63C4.description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.

79792C204856489AA5DC7CE78E30D116.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

F587CA64B9094F38BFECABDD7FC36651.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

C927905D69A2429E810511DFB72D6D22.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacherled) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others‚Äô ideas and expressing their own clearly:

BFB22E2AEC3D43BD92C541CB2EAD13EE.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

F3310FF695004A31B8F1B2C87EA5CF72.description: Write brief notes on information collected from experiences and/or print and digital sources, and sort into provided categories.

EAE0FF89F5A948D48D9EFB88A8F40E41.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic:

2D6BC583BAD745EC9007AAA9A6A90E90.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

72AFD7D32A5A47CD8E364E4E1BE13591.description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

C37FC909A527410C83F63EAC3420E1E1.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of related Writing Foundations and Language standards.)

229FAEF0AE794152AEEF30F10CE9F445.description: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

5B0E4A7336AE4C049F9BA917E41B88F7.description: Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

C4A7494DEE0D4708BD82328814D20CF8.description: Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

81024D8D72074EE489B62EE1C7C3AC33.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences:

E1094955DA5B4F2A89839AAE9792CF97.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

4236332631CD472C9D560EF34CEB24F0.description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.

B2E2753F25024B12BEB618E680F7CCD5.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

CFBB15A93F4C4F63839486CC75F9EF17.description: Introduce a topic and organize related information together; include illustrations when useful to aid comprehension.

A66F8329241544829164DD1FF2703853.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly:

68CBFB912CC8479399414AF625E6A93D.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the argument presented, as appropriate to the task.

9256C3444C854E169EC8223A2A65AABD.description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect the claim and reasons.

FBAD9DFCCC704570B09042F99DC5B070.description: Provide reasons that support the claim.

FFB3D6289112482AA87F391D9CC126B6.description: Introduce the topic or text they are writing about, state a claim, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons.

5130875CFA6B4CADA0B9ED4A7B4B4BEB.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a claim with reasons:

2FF8418C8D074462ACAFF02769BEF8E0.description: Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.

7110CFFC2CE7491D9E34B90955A8FF27.description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences .

742F85C19F6E4EBABB22C80C8B8BE6AD.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English when writing, including multi-paragraph texts:

CBCDBAA7FC8F4BE5A47CD10A489A39B3.description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

55A35A6C08E74E0EB636E9D799684137.description: Spell common, grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words.

56B06210F6F7470194812F12EDEC16FA.description: Identify language of origin for words, as noted in dictionaries.

7086D537BB0040BCBF1D638A08A272A8.description: Spell singular and plural possessives (e.g., teacher's, teachers').

82D252CE9CE347E28903EDCD13C0C55F.description: Include common, transparent prefixes and suffixes (e.g., re-, pre-, sub-, un-, dis-, mis-; -able, -ness, -ful, -tion)

B118068BDB254F8B972B10A6452FDE0D.description: Combine all basic syllable types (closed, VCe, open, vowel team, vowel-r, and consonant -le)

68E9A023248A4B989BF4A68744717053.description: Spell regular two-and three-syllable words that:

29E5A830D88D4E3F8B996A0390EC1E50.description: Complex Vowel-r Combinations (e.g., are, air, our, ore, ear, eer, ure, etc.)

5604BF76D6224C01A19829A78A6A5D6F.description: Less common, complex graphemes (e.g., ough, augh, old, -ind, -ost, -ild families)

8626F9828BB746229FD43F294B5BA909.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words:

88F5F0E9466A4DAF966459E3CACC3A03.description: Legibly and fluently write in manuscript to produce grade-appropriate tasks.

1CA05B54C2D141BC87D54E804415097C.description: Demonstrate and apply correct handwriting skills:

2786317469AF45AF8CE1FABB454B3574.description: Read and comprehend literary texts appropriately complex for grade 3.

1558B399AF034980AE674524A4F8ECFB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

48B3F27A325C42F19A7B28F4EB799C3A.description: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

ADB4D91AE229443EAD5DFD3A0B392A18.description: Explain how specific aspects of a print or digital text‚Äôs illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

54BE58C8839742BA8031BC484D292F27.description: Distinguish their own perspectives from that of the narrator or those of the characters, including identifying the point of view of the narrator.

F9C38B2D81064B97AC421769F4DE563B.description: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

6D2CF82EB7164D94B998B036D3B7B120.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

3E7AAB132C474BDF9CC93A1D1BE1F5F2.description: Using key details, describe characters in a story, including their traits, motivations, and feelings, and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

DF4ADBF5404845C1BDB370DD517C9E40.description: Retell stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures.

9CC5BCBA5F284E52952DC9DE4C9768A4.description: Determine a theme and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

770A8A10B0BD4121B10F4B907A3A4464.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

4A0ECD6CE971432E84AED9F01C4F4F41.description: Read and comprehend informational texts appropriately complex for grade 3.

8C571110400B420BAF7887C4D745A39B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7EB6EEBE30144E12A69500B2F5613DBB.description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

CA294912DA6A492BAD425E9F4A678DAC.description: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

0A47B07C684A421A8E4B4D86B026A87D.description: Use information gained from visual aids (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

E282348A18AA45DB9A6B87ED9BF5D16A.description: Distinguish their own point of view/perspective from that of the author of a text.

8691AC4CD05846878BAAFAA652592805.description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

F1112C51B9D342E3BF12C8C95450726A.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

E70CBB5FD5FC488F8C610BED301FC36F.description: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

2FB222DC102E49528C5F5CF05DF83FDC.description: Recount the key details and explain how they support the main/central idea.

5ED2E9C636BA40E0840BA1E105FC18E4.description: Determine the main/central idea of a text.

0129F3C2E0334529A55E95CC3FF80FA3.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring to the text as the basis for the answers.

343E9EEA7A924ED4803851BCA6A15758.description: Read grade-level text orally with fluency (accuracy, automaticity, and prosody) to support comprehension, in accordance with grade-level fluency norms.

5600986FFDAE486C8481B0A11F187E6C.description: Read common grade appropriate decodable and irregular high frequency words.

528080F4E9004028939387010BF66A28.description: Demonstrate and apply knowledge of syllable division and morpheme meaning when reading multisyllabic words.

4E688710D6A2431A95E4D48894B7F9FB.description: Multisyllabic words with the patterns: VC/CV, V/CV, VC/V, and CV/VC

1D203074625C4486A01D3D9A6BB064F6.description: Read regularly spelled single-syllable and multisyllabic words in isolation and in text, including:

27BC4F5B8D3C49A6AA88B7A683B2EBA4.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to read:
